adqlParser.parser
Class DBConsistency

java.lang.Object
  adqlParser.parser.DBConsistency
Direct Known Subclasses:
DefaultDBConsistency, SaadaDBConsistency
public abstract class DBConsistency
extends java.lang.Object

This class is used by AdqlParser to ensure the consistency between an ADQL query and the "database" on which the query must be executed.

Since in a query there might have some sub-query, this object must avoid merge columns and alias of the main query and of its sub-queries. To do that it is needed to call the DBConsistency#addContext() method at the beginning of a sub-query parsing and the removeContext() at the end of a sub-query parsing.

Version:
06/2010
Author:
Grégory Mantelet (CDS)
See Also:
AdqlParser

Field Detail

availableColumns

protected java.util.Stack<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>>> availableColumns
All columns contained in the selected tables (selected thanks to the FROM clause). Each item of the stack corresponds to a context and is a mapping between a column name to the list of tables which have a column with this column name.

columnsAlias

protected java.util.Stack<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> columnsAlias
Mapping between a column alias and a column name (mainly found in the SELECT clause). Each item of the stack corresponds to a context and is a mapping between a column alias to a column name.

tablesAlias

protected java.util.Stack<java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String>> tablesAlias
Mapping between a table alias and a table name (mainly found in the FROM clause). Each item of the stack corresponds to a context and is a mapping between a table alias to a table name.

protected java.util.Stack<ADQLQuery> queries

Method Detail

setDebug

public void setDebug(boolean debugging)

isDebugging

public boolean isDebugging()

addContext

public void addContext(ADQLQuery newQuery)
Adds an empty context, that's to say, in this new context the available columns, columns alias and tables alias lists are empty.
This is particularly useful if the parser needs to parse a sub-query and so to avoid merging two variables contexts.
This method must be called at each beginning of a sub-query parsing.

removeContext

public ADQLQuery removeContext()
Removes the last context, that's to say, the last context is replaced by its preceding.
This is particularly useful if the parser needs to parse a sub-query and so to avoid merging two variables contexts.
This method must be called at each end of a sub-query parsing.

getCurrentQuery

public final ADQLQuery getCurrentQuery()

lstColumns

protected final java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.Vector<java.lang.String>> lstColumns()
Gets the current list of all available columns according to the selected tables of the FROM clause.

Returns:
A mapping between a column name and a list of all tables which contains a column named like that.

                     throws ParseException

Parameters:

queryVerif

public boolean queryVerif(ADQLQuery q)
                   throws ParseException
Does the last verifications on the whole query generated by the parser.

Parameters:
q - The query to check.
Returns:
true if the query has passed successfully all the last modifications, false otherwise.
Throws:
ParseException - If there is some error !
